Comments_List: This class helped me understand more of the nuances behind research methods of political science.  Specifically the theory behind mixed methods and incorporating quantitative and qualitative methodology in research.
I learned how to create my own research design integrating both qualitative and quantitative methods.
Insight into the mixed methods research process
Some of the lessons felt a little repetitive and I could have used more background on a few methods before the ethical discussions.
The course was composed of a majority PhD students which made it hard to follow as an undergraduate student. I was definitely challenged.

Strengths: discussions, feedback, and office hours are all very in-depth and helpful. Morgan and Professor Nugent are both amazing--two of the best I have had at Yale!! 

It might have been helpful to spend a little more time on how to apply mixed methods techniques, as opposed to focusing on the theory, but there was so much critical information packed into one term.
Yes! Great way to start thinking about independent research/ if you are a junior, you can plan out your thesis in PoliSci!
Definitely, if you're at all interested in the subject matter.
